column13:
Quarterly bilateral meetings were held with Mangaung, Rustenburg, Nelson Mandela Bay, Cape Town and Ethekwini as follows:


Mangaung: 09 May

The purpose of the meeting was to present to DOT and give progress made and the city’s operational readiness towards the launch date and the following was highlighted during the meeting:

• The Department must have intervenors approach to get Mangaung to roll out as soon as possible.
• DoT encompasses appointing team of experts who’ll work with cities as IPTN monitors, which will be appointed on an ongoing basis to strengthen department’s oversight capacity in the city.
• Panel of experts across the eleven workstreams will be appointed by DoT to assist the cities where they struggle.
• Hours of operations: There will be the standard operating hours that the city will be expected to work on when operational, from 15 hours – 20 hours.
• Universal Access: The city must be 100% compliance with universal access.
• Number of passengers: There is a targeted number of passengers the IPTN cities should meet, for 2023/2024, 818 million passengers across all IPTNs.
• Single Integrated Ticketing System: The city must comply with the single ticketing system.


Rustenburg: 17 May

The meeting highlighted the following:

• The municipality would need to develop a database of all the operators of the affected associations.
• The municipality to report on its operational hours during the week as well as its weekend operational hours.
• The municipality needs to add Mop-up revenue on the monthly report to DoT.
• DoT to engage with NW Provincial Regulating Entities (PREs) on the Rustenburg/ Yarona IPTN challenges.
• The Department needs to engage with the Department of Education on grants the Department gives for disabled students.
• DoT to engage City of Cape town on the possibility of Cape Town offering its additional fleet of Optare’s to Rustenburg.

Nelson Mandela Bay: 14-15 June

The purpose of the meeting was to share progress update to the DOT, receive and note comments from NDOT and incorporate them.
Cape Town: 20-21 June 
The meeting highlighted the following: 

• The following costs should be justified in the PTNG Funding Application: increase in Park ‘n Rides budget; PTI budget (aligned to previous discussions); increase in NMT budget in 2025/26.
• PTNG incentive: The criteria is being finalised and will be shared the updated criteria at the next bilateral, as it will be finalised then.

eThekwini: 28 June
• The Department advised the city to review the Universal Access Design Plans (UADP) to ensure the alignment with Universal Access (UA) requirements. 
• An appropriation has been made for eThekwini Municipality 23/24, but it is dependent on Grant condition compliance and clarity if the PTOG allocation has been appropriated to the City.  A caution to City would be to not fast track the infrastructure but concentrate on getting operational.
